title: EU leaders should turn the screws on the Brexit wreckers by rejecting any further delay
text:
A majority in Parliament now backs Boris Johnson’s Withdrawal Agreement Bill in principle. But a majority has rejected the programme motion which would have been the only way to get this Bill passed by Parliament in time for Thursday 31 October, when the UK is currently due to leave the EU.

The best way to ensure that the UK leaves the EU on time on is for one or more of the EU27 Member States to veto an extension, or at most to grant a very short extension which would be final and not further extendable. Under Article 50, any extension decision is a matter for the representatives of the 27 remaining Member States in the European Council who have to decide unanimously in order to grant an extension,...
